trans-unit.source: Xbox Live
trans-unit.target: Xbox Live

trans-unit.source: This page explains how to configure your project to work with Xbox Live.
trans-unit.target: This page explains how to configure your project to work with Xbox Live.

trans-unit.source: 1. Before you start
trans-unit.target: 1. Before you start

trans-unit.source: Make sure your project uses UWP as a platform. To do this, you can either:
trans-unit.target: Make sure your project uses UWP as a platform. To do this, you can either:

trans-unit.source: create a project and select UWP as a platform, or
trans-unit.target: create a project and select UWP as a platform, or

source.g: add UWP as a platform to an existing project

target.g: add UWP as a platform to an existing project

trans-unit.source: !Tip For this tutorial, you might find it useful to create a new project to test the process, then apply the knowledge to your existing projects.
trans-unit.target: !Tip For this tutorial, you might find it useful to create a new project to test the process, then apply the knowledge to your existing projects.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you can run the project from UWP. To do this, in Visual Studio, select the platform you want (UWP-64, UWP-32, or UWP-ARM) from the Solution Platform drop-down list, and run the project.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you can run the project from UWP. To do this, in Visual Studio, select the platform you want (UWP-64, UWP-32, or UWP-ARM) from the Solution Platform drop-down list, and run the project.

trans-unit.source: Download the Xbox Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: Download the Xbox Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: To write this page, we used XboxLiveSDK-1612-20170114-002. The sample is loosely based on the Achievements sample in the Xbox Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: To write this page, we used XboxLiveSDK-1612-20170114-002. The sample is loosely based on the Achievements sample in the Xbox Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: Change your Xbox Live environment. In the SDK folder, under Tools, run:
trans-unit.target: Change your Xbox Live environment. In the SDK folder, under Tools, run:

trans-unit.source: SwitchSandbox.cmd XDKS.1
trans-unit.target: SwitchSandbox.cmd XDKS.1

trans-unit.source: XDKS.1 is the sandbox used for the Microsoft samples.
trans-unit.target: XDKS.1 is the sandbox used for the Microsoft samples.

trans-unit.source: !Warning This blocks regular Xbox accounts and only permits developer accounts. To switch back, run:
trans-unit.target: !Warning This blocks regular Xbox accounts and only permits developer accounts. To switch back, run:

trans-unit.source: SwitchSandbox.cmd RETAIL
trans-unit.target: SwitchSandbox.cmd RETAIL

trans-unit.source: Make sure you can run the Achievements sample with your developer account.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you can run the Achievements sample with your developer account.

trans-unit.source: 2. Add the Xbox Live SDK to your solution
trans-unit.target: 2. Add the Xbox Live SDK to your solution

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open your game solution.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open your game solution.

trans-unit.source: Open the Package Manager Console (Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Package Manager Console).
trans-unit.target: Open the Package Manager Console (Tools > NuGet Package Manager > Package Manager Console).

trans-unit.source: In the Default project field, select your UWP project (eg MyGame.UWP).
trans-unit.target: In the Default project field, select your UWP project (eg MyGame.UWP).

trans-unit.source: MyGame.UWP
trans-unit.target: MyGame.UWP

trans-unit.source: In the console, type:
trans-unit.target: In the console, type:

trans-unit.source: PM > Install-Package Microsoft.Xbox.Live.SDK.WinRT.UWP
trans-unit.target: PM > Install-Package Microsoft.Xbox.Live.SDK.WinRT.UWP

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio adds the NuGet package to your project.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio adds the NuGet package to your project.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the package appears in the References list.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the package appears in the References list.

trans-unit.source: Package in list
trans-unit.target: Package in list

trans-unit.source: 3. Configure the UWP project
trans-unit.target: 3. Configure the UWP project

trans-unit.source: Delete MyGame.UWP.TemporaryKey.pfx.
trans-unit.target: Delete MyGame.UWP.TemporaryKey.pfx.

trans-unit.source: Add xboxservices.config to your project.
trans-unit.target: Add xboxservices.config to your project.

trans-unit.source: You can get this file from any Xbox Live SDK sample (eg the Achievements sample) for test purposes. When you want to publish the game, change the TitleId and Service config Id with the ones provided for your project. For details, see the Xbox Live documentation.
trans-unit.target: You can get this file from any Xbox Live SDK sample (eg the Achievements sample) for test purposes. When you want to publish the game, change the TitleId and Service config Id with the ones provided for your project. For details, see the Xbox Live documentation.

trans-unit.source: In the xboxservices.config properties, under Build Action, select Content, and under Copy to Output Directory, select Always.
trans-unit.target: In the xboxservices.config properties, under Build Action, select Content, and under Copy to Output Directory, select Always.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Edit Package.appxmanifest with details relevant to your project.
trans-unit.target: Edit Package.appxmanifest with details relevant to your project.

trans-unit.source: Again, you can use the manifest file from any Xbox Live SDK sample (eg the Achievements sample) for test purposes. If you associate your game with a store app, use the generated manifest file. For details, see the Xbox Live documentation.
trans-unit.target: Again, you can use the manifest file from any Xbox Live SDK sample (eg the Achievements sample) for test purposes. If you associate your game with a store app, use the generated manifest file. For details, see the Xbox Live documentation.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the capability InternetClientServer is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the capability InternetClientServer is enabled.

trans-unit.source: 4. Add user account scripts to your game
trans-unit.target: 4. Add user account scripts to your game

trans-unit.source: You need to enable Xbox Live capability in your game project without exposing the Xbox Live SDK. As MyGame.UWP already references MyGame.Game, we can't reference it. Instead, we can create an interface and implement it from the UWP project side.
trans-unit.target: You need to enable Xbox Live capability in your game project without exposing the Xbox Live SDK. As MyGame.UWP already references MyGame.Game, we can't reference it. Instead, we can create an interface and implement it from the UWP project side.

trans-unit.source: !Note There are several ways to do this. This page explains one method.
trans-unit.target: !Note There are several ways to do this. This page explains one method.

trans-unit.source: Add two interfaces to your game, IAccountManager and IConnectedAccount.
trans-unit.target: Add two interfaces to your game, IAccountManager and IConnectedAccount.

trans-unit.source: On your UWP project (eg MyGame.UWP), implement the interfaces public class XboxAccount : IConnectedAccount and public class XboxLiveAccountManager : IAccountManager.
trans-unit.target: On your UWP project (eg MyGame.UWP), implement the interfaces public class XboxAccount : IConnectedAccount and public class XboxLiveAccountManager : IAccountManager.

trans-unit.source: Add the account factory to your game so you can access it later from a game script. In the MyGameMainPage.xaml.cs, add the following line:
trans-unit.target: Add the account factory to your game so you can access it later from a game script. In the MyGameMainPage.xaml.cs, add the following line:

trans-unit.source: Game.Services.AddService(typeof(IAccountManager), new XboxLiveAccountManager());
trans-unit.target: Game.Services.AddService(typeof(IAccountManager), new XboxLiveAccountManager());

trans-unit.source: References
trans-unit.target: References

trans-unit.source: The final script should look like this at minimum:
trans-unit.target: The final script should look like this at minimum:

trans-unit.source: Now you can expose the xbox_live_user functionality and other classes in your game.
trans-unit.target: Now you can expose the xbox_live_user functionality and other classes in your game.

trans-unit.target: Property Grid

trans-unit.target: Download a sample project with Xbox Live login functionality
